unnormalised: ## Unlocking Wellness: My Journey with Ayurveda Treatments
normalised: ## Unlocking Wellness: My Journey with Ayurveda Treatments

unnormalised: Hey everyone! So, lately, I've been diving deep into Ayurveda and wanted to share my experiences with some of the treatments. As you know, life in Mumbai can be hectic, and I felt like I needed something more than just yoga and meditation to truly center myself.
normalised: Hey everyone! So, lately, I've been diving deep into Ayurveda and wanted to share my experiences with some of the treatments. As you know, life in Mumbai can be hectic, and I felt like I needed something more than just yoga and meditation to truly center myself.

unnormalised: My first stop was a consultation at a small, family-run clinic in Kerala – Vaidyashala Ayur Care, near Kochi. Dr. Nair patiently listened to all my woes – stress, occasional sleeplessness, and a general feeling of being out of sync. He diagnosed me with a Pitta imbalance (thanks to all that city spice!).
normalised: My first stop was a consultation at a small, family-run clinic in Kerala – Vaidyashala Ayur Care, near Kochi. Doctor Nair patiently listened to all my woes – stress, occasional sleeplessness, and a general feeling of being out of sync. He diagnosed me with a Pitta imbalance (thanks to all that city spice!).

unnormalised: He prescribed a course of Abhyanga – warm oil massage – which was unbelievably relaxing! I swear, after the first session, I felt like I'd shed 10 years and a ton of stress. They used sesame oil infused with herbs, and the therapist was super skilled. It was followed by a Shirodhara treatment – warm oil gently poured onto my forehead. Pure bliss!
normalised: He prescribed a course of Abhyanga – warm oil massage – which was unbelievably relaxing! I swear, after the first session, I felt like I'd shed ten years and a ton of stress. They used sesame oil infused with herbs, and the therapist was super skilled. It was followed by a Shirodhara treatment – warm oil gently poured onto my forehead. Pure bliss!

unnormalised: I also tried Nasya, where medicated oils are administered through the nostrils. Initially, it felt a little strange, but Dr. Nair explained that it helps clear the sinuses and improve mental clarity. He was right! My headaches disappeared.
normalised: I also tried Nasya, where medicated oils are administered through the nostrils. Initially, it felt a little strange, but Doctor Nair explained that it helps clear the sinuses and improve mental clarity. He was right! My headaches disappeared.

unnormalised: The treatments weren’t exactly cheap, costing around Rs. 5000 per session on average, but honestly, I felt it was worth every rupee. Back in Mumbai, I've been following his dietary recommendations – less spicy food, more cooling fruits like watermelon and coconut water.

unnormalised: I'm even considering a Panchakarma retreat at the Arya Vaidya Sala in Kottakkal next year. Apparently, it's a powerful detoxification and rejuvenation program. A friend of mine went last year and said the facilities are amazing – sprawling over 20,000 sq ft with lush gardens.

unnormalised: Ayurveda isn't a quick fix; it's a lifestyle. But from my experience, it’s been incredibly beneficial for improving my overall well-being. Have you guys tried any Ayurvedic treatments? Let me know in the comments! I'd love to hear your experiences!
